alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe; Quay; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 10:15PM MDT until June 22 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... West central Quay County in east central New Mexico... Northeastern Guadalupe County in east central New Mexico... * Until 1115 PM MDT. * At 1013 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles south of Conchas, or 23 miles west of Tucumcari, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Tucumcari. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 328 and 339. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 69 and 71, and between Mile Markers 79 and 105. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
